body_html:
It also does not work for string. I think you might be able to replace + with logical_or to make it work on bool dtypes. Nothing I can come up with for strings, sadly.
…
On Thu, Nov 16, 2017 at 12:25 PM, Stephan Hoyer ***@***.***> wrote: There is a quick way to implement a broadcast_to(tensor, shape) function (though not super efficient); The version using + appears to work on many but not all dtypes: >>> broadcast_to(tf.convert_to_tensor([True]), (2,)).eval() TypeError: Value passed to parameter 'x' has DataType bool not in list of allowed values: float16, float32, float64, uint8, int8, int16, int32, int64, complex64, complex128, string — You are receiving this because you commented. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#14509 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAATxbkKvxrFk5uuwIpOzbpwMIVWXLYtks5s3JpRgaJpZM4QbQ_2> .
-- - Alex
body_text:
It also does not work for string. I think you might be able to replace +
with logical_or to make it work on bool dtypes. Nothing I can come up with
for strings, sadly.
…
On Thu, Nov 16, 2017 at 12:25 PM, Stephan Hoyer ***@***.***> wrote:
 There is a quick way to implement a broadcast_to(tensor, shape) function
 (though not super efficient);

 The version using + appears to work on many but not all dtypes:

 >>> broadcast_to(tf.convert_to_tensor([True]), (2,)).eval()
 TypeError: Value passed to parameter 'x' has DataType bool not in list of allowed values: float16, float32, float64, uint8, int8, int16, int32, int64, complex64, complex128, string

 —
 You are receiving this because you commented.

body:
It also does not work for string. I think you might be able to replace +
with logical_or to make it work on bool dtypes. Nothing I can come up with
for strings, sadly.

On Thu, Nov 16, 2017 at 12:25 PM, Stephan Hoyer <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> There is a quick way to implement a broadcast_to(tensor, shape) function
> (though not super efficient);
>
> The version using + appears to work on many but not all dtypes:
>
> >>> broadcast_to(tf.convert_to_tensor([True]), (2,)).eval()
> TypeError: Value passed to parameter 'x' has DataType bool not in list of allowed values: float16, float32, float64, uint8, int8, int16, int32, int64, complex64, complex128, string
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you commented.

> or mute the thread

> .
